thread.title: Zaheer Abbas fears Pakistan's WT20 participation in jeopardy
thread.title_full: Zaheer Abbas fears Pakistan's WT20 participation in jeopardy

title: Zaheer Abbas fears Pakistan's WT20 participation in jeopardy
text:
18:42 Posted by Imaduddin 1 
KARACHI: The President of International Cricket Council (ICC), Zaheer Abbas has feared that if the security situation persisted then the participation of Pakistan cricketers in the upcoming World T20 Cup could get jeopardised. 
"I fear the Pakistan players could also refuse to tour India for the upcoming ICC World T20 competition, citing security concerns", Zaheer Abbas told a private telvision channel on Monday while reacting to the developments in Mumbai. 
According to reports, a bunch of protesters chanted slogans against the visiting PCB chairman Sheharyar Muhammad Khan at the BCCI office in Mumbai on Monday Morning, where he was present at the invitation of his Indian counterpart to talk on bilateral cricket series. 
The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said the BCCI should honour the MoU, signed last year, according to which both the countries will play number of home and away series in the coming years. 
On the other hand the BCCI is of the view that the fate of bilateral cricket was dependent on their government's nod. 
The latest threats to the elite-panel umpire, Aleem Dar, the ICC president said the matter will be reviewed in consultation with the Board of Control form Cricket in India. 
Aleem Dar is currently in India to supervise matches of ongoing One-day series between MS Dhoni's Indian against AB de Villiers South African team. Copyright APP (Associated Press of Pakistan), 2015
